definition: (of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: Never make a move if you are merely optimistic.
sentences.chinese: 如果你只是乐观而已，千万不要轻举妄动。

sentences.english: North Korea is great anger, Shen Weijing has warned north Korea not to move.
sentences.chinese: 朝鲜君臣大怒，沈惟敬反而警告朝鲜不得妄动。

sentences.english: This is not a trivial matter,don't be indiscretion.
sentences.chinese: 这件事非同小可，不能轻举妄动。

sentences.english: But the Japanese government did not dare to take any further action for fear of reaction from China.
sentences.chinese: 由于顾忌中国的反应，日本政府未敢轻举妄动。

sentences.english: The rash action will encounter the curse.
So much of that thing has been done by these reckless Abolitionists.
sentences.chinese: 那些轻举妄动的废奴派做得实在太过份了。

sentences.english: No money and no wise naturally we carefully offend.
sentences.chinese: 没钱又没见识的我们自然小心翼翼不敢轻举妄动。

definition: to fiddle with/to tamper with/to meddle with/to move randomly/to flail about
lit. to refrain from shooting at the rat for fear of breaking the vases (idiom)/to not act against an evil so as to prevent harm to innocents
to obey an order/to take orders/to accept a state of affairs
to disobey/to defy an edict/to violate/to go against/to run counter to
disobedient/to violate the Mandate of Heaven (天命[Tian1 Ming4])
to act arbitrarily regardless of the rules/to mess with sth/to make a hash of things/to cause trouble
facing a powerful enemy (idiom); fig. confronting grave difficulties/Enemy at the Gates, 1991 movie by Jean-Jacques Annaud
against orders/to disobey/to refuse to accept orders
